channel.title: RAM Help
channel.description:
Hey guys, I recently started using one of my old laptops, and it's 2gig ram. It still has 1 slot left, will it take another 1-2gig ram in that slot?, because this scan says it won't?
Though.. this scan also says each slot can only handle 1gig, which is not true because 1 out of the 2 slots contains a 2gig Ram? Look at the highlighted red boxes for main scan facts. [IMG]http://i1006.photobucket.com/albums/af190/justinxg27/Scan.png[/img]

item.title: RAM Help
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:19, topic:360926”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=457218.msg3349595#msg3349595 date=1285155704]

[quote author=Lin link=topic=457218.msg3349542#msg3349542 date=1285143394]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=457218.msg3349483#msg3349483 date=1285132469]

[quote author=Lin link=topic=457218.msg3347744#msg3347744 date=1284949955]
No offense, but are you really asking this? “Maximum Memory Capacity: 2048MB” “Current Installed Memory: 2GB” Computers DO have a memory capacity… If you want to go high go 64-bit.
[/quote][quote author=Lin link=topic=457218.msg3347779#msg3347779 date=1284951643]
Actually with your computer, it shouldn’t be possible at all. If it can only get to 2GB, then no. I know it depends on the operating system, but also the computer itself. For example, Windows XP 32-bit can only hold 4GB period. My computer can only hold 2GB though.
[/quote]Seriously, do not post if you have no clue as to what you’re talking about. In this case, the RAM limitation isn’t imposed by the operating system, it’s imposed by the motherboard. So no, don’t install 64-bit as it will do nothing. You have to get another motherboard because the one you have is shit.
[/quote]No shit. However, if you have a better motherboard and something like Windows XP 32-bit, you can’t have more than 4GB of RAM, so fuck off.
[/quote]That wasn’t his problem though was it, you fucking retard?
[/quote]Rofl you can’t stand to even come close to losing an argument, can you? You’re the ALL-MIGHTY ABRAHAM, so go do something productive instead of trying to be always right on a community full of retards.[/quote]

Abraham, have you ever had anger management classes? You really need to chill the fuck out

Sorry Arab, it’s true.

Read full topic

[/quote]Seriously, do not post if you have no clue as to what you’re talking about. In this case, the RAM limitation isn’t imposed by the operating system, it’s imposed by the motherboard. So no, don’t install 64-bit as it will do nothing. You have to get another motherboard because the one you have is shit.
[/quote]No shit. However, if you have a better motherboard and something like Windows XP 32-bit, you can’t have more than 4GB of RAM, so fuck off.
[/quote]That wasn’t his problem though was it, you fucking retard?[/quote]Rofl you can’t stand to even come close to losing an argument, can you? You’re the ALL-MIGHTY ABRAHAM, so go do something productive instead of trying to be always right on a community full of retards.

item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:15, topic:360926”]just be happy u got 2 gigs of ram lol my comp has 512mb…[/quote]Well, I play world of Warcraft, and… 2gigs on Vista isn’t enough for it to go smooth. If I had XP with 2 gigs, then It would be fine… But I don’t even know where to buy XP OS anymore, besides online, which I’m not going to do.
